categories.name: Health & Mortality
categories.description: CDC mortality, disease surveillance, and health outcomes data

datasets.title: CDC WONDER: Drug Overdose Deaths
datasets.description: County-level drug overdose deaths by month. Gold standard for overdose research.
datasets.notes: Values 1-9 suppressed for privacy. Use Multiple Cause of Death database.

collisions.hypothesis: Do opioid deaths spike 1-6 months after major disasters? (Displacement, PTSD, treatment disruption)
Does county unemployment predict overdose rates? (Economic despair pathway)
Do high-churn counties have higher overdose rates? (Social disconnection)

datasets.title: CDC WONDER: Underlying Cause of Death
datasets.description: All-cause mortality by county, age, race, sex. Most comprehensive mortality data.

collisions.hypothesis: Do high-pollution counties have elevated mortality? (Beyond EPA thresholds)

datasets.title: CDC BRFSS: Behavioral Risk Factors
datasets.description: Annual telephone survey on health behaviors, chronic conditions, preventive services.

datasets.title: CDC WONDER: Daily Air Temperatures
datasets.description: County-level daily temperatures and heat index from satellite data.

collisions.hypothesis: Is there a temperature threshold where violent crime accelerates?

categories.name: Weather & Climate
categories.description: NOAA storm events, climate normals, and extreme weather data

datasets.title: NOAA Storm Events Database
datasets.description: Every significant weather event: tornadoes, floods, hurricanes, hail. Includes damage estimates and casualties.
datasets.notes: CZ_FIPS is county zone, not full county FIPS. Combine with STATE_FIPS.

collisions.hypothesis: Invisible second wave: overdose deaths spike 2 months after major storms
Does violent crime spike after weather disasters?
Do storms cause lasting unemployment spikes in affected counties?

datasets.title: NOAA Daily Climate Normals (1991-2020)
datasets.description: 30-year average temperatures by weather station. Baseline for anomaly detection.

collisions.hypothesis: It's not absolute temperature‚Äîit's deviation from normal that drives crime

datasets.title: NOAA Severe Weather Data Inventory (SWDI)
datasets.description: Radar-detected severe weather: hail, tornadoes, mesocyclones. Point data with lat/lon.

datasets.title: EPA Heat Wave Characteristics
datasets.description: Heat wave frequency, duration, intensity for 50 large cities, 1961-2023.

categories.name: Crime & Justice
categories.description: FBI crime statistics, arrests, and criminal justice data

datasets.title: FBI Uniform Crime Reports (UCR)
datasets.description: County-level crime rates by type (violent, property). Primary source for crime research.
datasets.notes: Transitioning to NIBRS. Historical UCR data still available.

collisions.hypothesis: Temperature-crime threshold: at what degree does violence spike?
Post-disaster crime waves: looting, domestic violence, fraud
Does poor air quality correlate with assault rates? (Pollution ‚Üí aggression)

datasets.title: FBI NIBRS: Incident-Based Reporting
datasets.description: Detailed incident-level crime data with victim/offender demographics.
datasets.notes: More detailed than UCR but coverage varies by state.

datasets.title: BJS National Crime Victimization Survey
datasets.description: Survey-based crime data including unreported crimes. Complements UCR.

categories.name: Economics & Labor
categories.description: BLS employment, wages, and economic indicators

datasets.title: BLS Local Area Unemployment Statistics
datasets.description: County-level unemployment rates, monthly. Key economic distress indicator.

collisions.hypothesis: Unemployment ‚Üí overdose: does economic despair drive addiction?

datasets.title: BLS Quarterly Census of Employment & Wages
datasets.description: Employment and wages by industry and county. Most comprehensive employment data.

datasets.title: Census ACS: Income & Poverty
datasets.description: Median household income, poverty rates, and economic characteristics.

categories.name: Demographics & Census
categories.description: Census population, migration, and demographic data

datasets.title: Census Population Estimates
datasets.description: Annual county population estimates between decennial censuses.

datasets.title: Census ACS: Migration Flows
datasets.description: County-to-county migration patterns from ACS.

collisions.hypothesis: Does high migration churn correlate with overdose rates?

datasets.title: Census ACS: Demographic Characteristics
datasets.description: Age, sex, race, ethnicity, education, and housing characteristics.

categories.name: Environment & Energy
categories.description: EPA pollution, air quality, and environmental data

datasets.title: EPA Air Quality System (AQS)
datasets.description: Daily air quality measurements (PM2.5, ozone) by monitoring station.

collisions.hypothesis: Bad air ‚Üí bad moods ‚Üí assault? (Pollution-aggression link)
Air quality exceeds thresholds ‚Üí mortality spike

datasets.title: EPA Toxics Release Inventory
datasets.description: Industrial toxic chemical releases by facility.

datasets.title: USGS National Water Information System
datasets.description: Streamflow, groundwater levels, and water quality data.

datasets.title: NOAA US Drought Monitor
datasets.description: Weekly drought severity maps at county level.

collisions.hypothesis: Multi-year droughts in farming counties ‚Üí suicide spikes?
